_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary



A.   Accidental Release Prevention

The purpose of the accidental release prevention and emergency action programs is to prevent the occurrence, and minimize the consequences, of significant releases of toxic substances as well as fires, explosions, and other types of catastrophic accidents.  Overall, these programs prevent accidental fatalities, injuries and illnesses and avoid physical property damage. Nordic Nashville, LLC provides a safe work environment for employees. Employee safety is a serious committment and our employees are required to cooperate and participate in our safety programs.  Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Policies are designed to comply with the OSHA Process Safety Management standards (29 CFR 1910.119) and the EPA Risk Management Prevention Plan regulations (40 CFR Part 68). 



B.  Stationary Source and Regulated Substances Handled

Nordic Nashville, LLC a cold storage warehouse for the perishable foods.  This facility uses an ammonia refrigeration system to provide cooling and freezing capabilities. Since the ammonia system falls under the OSHA PSM standard, the system is subject to the Program 3 requirements of the EPA Risk Management regulations.  The ammonia refrigeration system provides warehouse space at various refrigerated temperatures for storage of perishable foods.  The refrigeration system provides temperatures of -47F, +20F, & +35F. The higher pressure portions of the system include the condenser, located on the roof, along with refrigerant piping. 



C. Description of the Accidental Release Prevention Program

The prevention program (OSHA Process Safety Management CFR 1910.119) consists of the following elements:

Employee Participation

Process Safety Information

Process Hazard Analysis

Operating Procedures

Training

Contractors

Pre-startup Safety Review

Mechanical Integrity

Hot Work Permit

Management of Change

Incident Investigation

Compliance Audits



D.  Five-Year Accident History

There were no EPA reportable incidents at this facility in the previous five years.



E.  Emergency Response Program

This facility has an Emergency Action Plan.  The plan contains procedures describing how the facility will respond to ammonia spills and other emergencies, including evacuation procedures, escape routes, critical operations shutdown procedures, procedures to account for all employees, rescue and medical duties assignment, means of reporting fires and emergencies, name of responsible person, alarm system, training and fire prevention.
